title: RADS Error - Firewall is off.
body:
I'm getting the RADS error whenever I try to launch the client. My firewall is off, I've cleared the registry, flushed the DNS, and I'm running the game as administrator. There's nothing wrong with my network settings because my flatmate is playing URF right now while I'm stuck here sitting at my computer trying to figure out how to fix the problem. I've removed the game and restored it using my flatmate's working copy, and I still get the same RADS error. Which clearly suggests something other than the game's actual files (hence I cleansed the registry in case of old files or references).

The only thing I have going for me, is that I'm reasonably certain what created this issue. I was patching the game the other week (before which it had been working fine), but my laptop ran out of battery and the computer shut off, interrupting the patching process. I couldn't be bothered doing anything then, because I expected to have to repatch, but this issue has come up instead. So is there any handy solutions to this RADS issue?

replies.body:
If you've (effectively) reinstalled the game, then your laptop shutting off prematurely wouldn't have an effect on anything.

What you can do is try [using an alternative DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5) altogether.
